intro: Verbesina oaxacana, commonly known as Mexican sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its vibrant orange to yellow flowers and feathery leaves. The plant typically grows as an upright annual or perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its flowers bloom in late summer and early fall, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is also valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated in gardens for its striking appearance.
